text:
Stones thrown at houses near Sulur

People of Appanaickenpatti Pudur village near Sulur are having sleepless nights over the last five days, following throwing of stones at a few houses by unidentified persons. According to the villagers, stones were thrown at the houses of Sundaram, a temple priest, and his neighbour Veeramohan, a mill worker, from March 12.

The stones have damaged the asbestos roof of one of the houses. Based on a complaint lodged by the villagers with the Sulur Police, a team conducted an inquiry on Friday. Police sources suspected that it could be the work of trouble mongers.

While a case was not registered, inquiries were under way.

Complaint against jewellery outlet owner

Kattoor Police are inquiring a harassment complaint against the owner of a jewellery outlet located on Cross Cut Road.

The police said that they received a petition via post about four days ago.

The petition, signed as employees of the firm, stated that the employees including women were being harassed by the owner.

While the police have suspicion over the authenticity of the complaint, they said that a case would be registered and further action initiated on confirmation of charges.
